BaseModel

BaseModel

class models.BaseModel.BaseModel(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)

Base class for all models.

__init__(config: Config)
Parameters:

  • config – the configuration object intialized by utils.manager.Manager._post_init_config_from_hydra()

  • name – the name of the model

metrics

the metric dictionary containing metric_type: metric_value pairs

Type:

dict

config
name

the name of the model

Type:

str

index_dir

the folder to save index e.g. utils.index.FaissIndex and utils.index.InvertedVectorIndex

Type:

str

collection_dir

the folder to save json collections returned by e.g. utils.index.AnseriniBM25Index.fit()

Type:

str

encode_dir

the folder to save text encoding memmap file returned by models.BaseModel.BaseSparseModel.encode_text()

Type:

str

query_dir

the folder to save query encoding memmap file returned by models.BaseModel.BaseSparseModel.encode_query()

Type:

str

retrieval_result_path

the path of the final retrieval result file returned by models.BaseModel.BaseModel.retrieve()

Type:

str

_rank

the current process ID

Type:

int

_world_size

the number of all processes

Type:

int

_distributed

if distributed training/evaluating is enabled

Type:

bool

logger

the logger

Type:

MasterLoger

_l2_distance(x1: torch.Tensor, x2: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor

Compute l2 similarity.

Parameters:

  • x1 – tensor of [B, D]

  • x2 – tensor of [B, D]

_cos_sim(x1: torch.Tensor, x2: torch.Tensor, temperature: float = 0.1) → torch.Tensor

Compute cosine similarity.

Parameters:

  • x1 – tensor of [B, D]

  • x2 – tensor of [B, D]

  • temperature – scale the similarity scores by dividing temperature

_distillce(query_teacher_embedding: torch.Tensor, pos_seq_teacher_embedding: torch.Tensor, neg_seq_teacher_embedding: torch.Tensor, student_scores: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor

Compute cross-entropy (KL) distillation loss.

Parameters:

  • query_teacher_embedding – tensor of [B, D]

  • pos_seq_teacher_embedding – tensor of [B, D]

  • neg_seq_teacher_embedding – tensor of [B, N, D]

  • student_scores – tensor of [B, B/1+N]

Returns:

1-element tensor

_get_optimizer(dataloader_length: int = 0) → tuple[torch.optim.Optimizer, Any]

Create optimizer and scheduler for the training process; Subclass may override this function to create custom optimizers.

Parameters:

dataloader_length – the training steps per epoch

Returns:

optimizer scheduler

_gather_objects(local_object: object) → list[object]

Gather common python objects across processes.

Note

This function implicitly consumes GPU.

Parameters:

local_object – python object to collect

_gather_tensors(local_tensor: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor

Gather tensors from all gpus on each process.

Parameters:

local_tensor – the tensor that needs to be gathered

Returns:

concatenation of local_tensor in each process

_gather_retrieval_result(retrieval_result: Union[dict[int, list[int]], dict[int, list[tuple[int, float]]]], hits: Optional[int] = None, retrieval_result_path: Optional[str] = None) → Union[dict[int, list[int]], dict[int, list[tuple[int, float]]]]

  1. Gather retrieval_result across processes;

  2. Returning the reordered result cut off to top k;

  3. Create a lock;

  4. Save the result at models.BaseModel.BaseModel.retrieval_result_path.

  5. Release the lock.

Parameters:

retrieval_result – each tuple is a document id-score pair

Returns:

processed retrieval result

_synchronize()

Synchronize all processes in the distributed group by torch.dist.barrier().

save_to_mmp(path: str, shape: tuple, dtype: dtype, loader: torch.utils.data.DataLoader, obj: ndarray, batch_size: int = 1000)

  1. Create a np.memmap file of shape with dtype;

  2. Create lock;

  3. Save the obj to the offset utils.util.Sequential_Sampler.start;

  4. Release lock.

Parameters:

  • path – the memmap file path

  • shape – the shape of the memmap file to be created

  • dtype –

  • loader – the dataloader for the data

  • obj – the array to be stored

  • batch_size – saving in batch

index(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader])

The index method. Subclass should override this function.

retrieve(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader])

The retrieve method. Subclass should override this function.

rerank(loaders: dict)

Rerank the candidates in utils.dataset.PairDataset.

init_verifier(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader], load_all_verifier: bool = False)

Initialize post verifier defined in :pyobj:utils.index.VERIFIER_MAP.

Parameters:

  • loaders –

  • load_all_verifier – if True, load all the verifier embeddings/codes

dev(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader], step: Optional[int] = None)

  1. Evaluate the model on config.eval_set;

  2. Log the metrics;

  3. Save the checkpoint if necessary.

Parameters:

step – the name to use when saving the checkpoint if config.save_at_eval==True

log_result()

Wrapper for logging metrics in evaluating.

save(checkpoint: Optional[int] = None)

Save the model at checkpoint.

load()

Load the model with current config from config.load_ckpt.

classmethod from_pretrained(ckpt_path: str, device: Union[int, Literal['cpu']] = 'cpu')

Load model and its config from ckpt_path.

Parameters:

  • cls – the model class

  • ckpt_path – the path to the model checkpoint

  • device – the device to load the model

Returns:

the loaded model

generate_code(loaders)

Generate text codes used in Model-Based IR.

encode(loaders)

Shotcut for encoding both text and query.

_compute_overlap(query_token_id: torch.Tensor, seq_token_id: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor

Compute overlapping mask between the query tokens and sequence tokens.

Parameters:

  • query_token_id – [B, LQ]

  • seq_token_id – [B, (N,) LS]

Returns:

overlapping_mask of [B, (N,) LQ, LS]

_compute_overlap_inbatch(query_token_id: torch.Tensor, pos_seq_token_id: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor

Compute overlapping mask between the query tokens and positive sequence tokens across batches.

Parameters:

  • query_token_id – [B, LQ]

  • pos_seq_token_id – [B, LS]

Returns:

[B, LQ, B, LS]

Return type:

overlapping_mask

_gate_query(query_embeddings: ndarray, query_token_ids: ndarray, k: Optional[int] = None)

Gate the query token weights so that only the top config.query_gate_k tokens are valid. Moreover, change the gated token ids to -1.

Parameters:

query_embeddings – [N, L, 1]

_gate_text(text_embeddings: ndarray, k: Optional[int] = None)

Gate the text token weights so that only the top config.query_gate_k tokens are valid.

Parameters:

query_embeddings – [N, L, 1]

inverted_index(loader_text: torch.utils.data.DataLoader)

Construct utils.index.BaseInvertedIndex.

anserini_index(loader_text: torch.utils.data.DataLoader)

Construct utils.index.BaseAnseriniIndex.

index(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader])

Wrapper to construct a variety of sparse indexes. Subclass may override this function to create customized index.

retrieve(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader]) → Union[dict[int, list[int]], dict[int, list[tuple[int, float]]]]

  1. Retrieve by the index;

  2. Compute auxillary metrics if necessary;

  3. Post verify if necessary.

Returns:

retrieval result

encode_text(loader_text: torch.utils.data.DataLoader, load_all_encode: bool = False)

Encode texts into token weights or token vecs.

Parameters:

load_all_encode – bool, set to true to load the entire cache file

Returns:

text_embeddings: array of [N, L, D] text_token_ids: array of [N, L]

Return type:

BaseOutput

encode_query(loader_query: torch.utils.data.DataLoader, load_all_encode: bool = False)

Encode each query into a weight or a vector.

Parameters:

load_all_encode – if True, load all cached memmap from models.BaseModel.BaseModel.encode_dir

Returns:

embeddings: np.ndarray of [N, L, D] token_ids: np.ndarray of [N, L]

Return type:

BaseOutput

compute_flops(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader], text_token_ids: ndarray, text_token_weights: ndarray, query_token_ids: ndarray, query_token_weights: ndarray, log: bool = True)

Compute flops as stated in SPLADE;

Note

This function uses the cached embedding to compute flops.

generate_code(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader])

Generate codes from the cache embedding files.

trie_index(loader_text: torch.utils.data.DataLoader)

Construct utils.index.TrieIndex.

index(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader])

Wrapper to construct a variety of trie indexes. Subclass may override this function to create customized index.

retrieve(loaders: dict[str, torch.utils.data.DataLoader]) → Union[dict[int, list[int]], dict[int, list[tuple[int, float]]]]

  1. Retrieve by the index;

  2. Save the generated query codes if necessary;

  3. Compute auxillary metrics if necessary;

  4. Post verify if necessary.

Returns:

retrieval result
